item.title: Shades of meaning: visualising geographical data with colour in a data-driven web application
item.description: Colour and maps are two crucial aspects of data visualisation, and putting them together is a classic technique for revealing geographical patterns in data. William Smith's geological map of 1815 If data values are discrete, selecting the colours to use is straightforward - just choose an appropriate colour for each value. For continuous data, a colour scale is required, where any numeric value in the data range can be mapped to a colour, and where the gradations in colour are visually meaningful.
